广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2023 年 11 月 1 日星期三 17:58:58 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.2.3 《美国偶像》演员德鲁·西利 (Drew Seeley) 主演《真爱至上》电影 20 周年庆典https://www.billboard.com/music/concerts/love-actually-live-2023-cast-dates-tickets-1235459552/ Wed, 01 Nov 2023 18:00:00 +0000 ConcertsMusicchristmasDrew Seeley https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235459552 The Broadway-style show celebrates the 20th anniversary of 'Love Actually,' the star-studded rom-com that has become a festive favorite for the holidays

《歌舞青春》明星德鲁·西利 (Drew Seeley) 和《美国偶像》第 19 季决赛入围者格蕾丝·金斯特勒 (Grace Kinstler) 领衔今年《真爱现场》的演员阵容，这是一部百老汇风格的节目，将受热门假日电影启发的歌曲与电影本身的场景结合起来，打造了一场——独一无二的音乐和电影体验。

Seeley 和 Kinstler 将与《美国达人秀》第 17 季金压哨奖得主麦迪逊·泰勒·贝兹 (Madison Taylor Baez) 一同登台； 《好声音》决赛入围者、 YouTube 红人克里斯·曼 (Chris Mann)； 《油脂：粉红女郎崛起》演员夏延·伊莎贝尔·威尔斯；以及来自女子组合“公民女王”的尼娜·尼尔森，此外还有舞台和银幕资深演员的演员阵容。

今年的节目庆祝《真爱至上》上映 20 周年，这部众星云集的浪漫喜剧已成为节日期间的热门节目。自制作公司 For the Record 推出《真爱现场》以来，五年过去了，该剧再次回到洛杉矶沃利斯·安纳伯格表演艺术中心。

当电影场景在大屏幕上播放时，舞台上的现场乐队将与歌手一起演唱圣诞节经典歌曲和《真爱至上》原声带中的歌曲，如“Christmas Is All around”、Kelly Clarkson 的“The Trouble” with Love Is”和乔尼·米切尔的“Both Sides Now”。组织者表示，期待这部电影的“多媒体音乐会庆典”，“将沃利斯布拉姆戈德史密斯剧院转变为现代的大型沉浸式电影院”。

由 Shane Scheel 和 The Wallis 联合制作的《真爱现场》自 2018 年首播以来已向近 45,000 名观众播放，观众中还出现了黛米·摩尔、凯瑟琳·奥哈拉、汤姆·汉克斯和哈莉·贝利等名人。

该演出门票可在TheWallis.org购买，11 月 22 日至 11 月 28 日预演价格为 69 至 119 美元，11 月 29 日至 12 月 30 日所有演出价格为 79 至 139 美元。

购买：真爱至上 [蓝光] $7.79

至于原著电影？ 《真爱至上》目前在亚马逊上提供蓝光/DVD 版本，起价仅为 7.99 美元（截至撰写本文时）。您还可以在 Prime Video 上租借在线观看《真爱至上》 。

; 原田知世谈新翻唱专辑、音乐事业的转折点：《日本公告牌音乐界女性》专访https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/tomoyo-harada-billboard-japan-women-in-music-interview-1235461288/ Wed, 01 Nov 2023 17:58:50 +0000 MusicMusic NewsBillboard JapanGlobalJapan https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235461288 Harada sat down with Billboard Japan to chat about her new album and look back on the turning points in her lauded career.

日本标志性歌手兼演员原田知代接受了日本公告牌 (Billboard Japan) 的女性音乐人采访系列，庆祝该国娱乐界的女性玩家。日本的 WIM 倡议于去年开始，旨在表彰对音乐做出重大贡献并通过工作激励其他女性的艺术家、制作人和高管。

原田于 1982 年以青少年身份首次亮相，并因主演大林信彦的《穿越时空的女孩》(1983)而迅速成为家喻户晓的人物。此后，她确立了自己作为一名多产演员和歌手的地位，她最近发行的音乐是她的第四张翻唱情歌专辑，名为《仁爱少女 4 ~ 音乐飞翔》 （“爱情故事 4：音乐飞行” ） ，该专辑于 10 月 12 日发行。 25.

有关的

反对中不自由表达自己：《Billboard Japan Women in Music》访谈

11/01/2023

虽然这位屡获殊荣的超级巨星自出道以来短暂的存在和舒缓的歌声似乎没有变化，但她早已在娱乐圈长大，并一路经历了一些困难。原田与 Billboard Japan 坐下来讨论了她的新专辑，回顾了她备受赞誉的职业生涯的转折点，同时也分享了最近激励她的音乐。

祝贺你的新专辑发行。你喜欢它什么？

与原创专辑不同的是，这套专辑中的歌曲都是很多人喜爱的歌曲。而且，它们之前已经被很多人演唱过。当我听这些歌曲的不同版本时，里面隐藏着很多暗示。有一些我从未想过的歌唱方式，还有英语特有的细微差别无法用日语表达，所以我学到了很多关于表达的知识。这些发现是只有翻唱专辑才能提供的乐趣。

您在这个系列中主要挑选了60、70年代深受几代人喜爱的经典作品。

我们希望呈现出能温柔地陪伴人们日常生活的音乐，所以我与制作人伊藤五郎和我的团队一起决定了这些歌曲，考虑到了整体的平衡。伊藤先生总是想出可爱、有趣的编曲，所以我在制作过程中也很享受。

有些歌曲对我来说非常个人化。例如，Neil Young 的《Only Love Can Break Your Heart》是我比我大十岁的哥哥在长崎童年时经常唱的一首歌。当我和比我大两岁的姐姐弹奏时，我们会听到他在房间里努力练习，弹着他刚学的吉他。听到这首歌，我想起了和姐姐一起听的温暖回忆。

曲目列表中的歌曲可能会唤起每个听众的不同回忆。您当时有崇拜的女性榜样吗？

我不太记得了……现在，我觉得内心坚韧的女人是美丽的。如果你有内在的力量，你就能保持灵活性，你知道吗？我也想成为那样的人，也希望在我的音乐中表达出来。

你是最近才开始这么想的吗？

不，我认为这是我内心逐渐成长的东西。当你年轻的时候，你有时会变得非常严肃和固执。就像直截了当是唯一的方法一样。随着年龄的增长，你会获得更多的视角，并发展出一种内在的力量。我认为这种力量可以让你保持灵活性，不会轻易折断。不是肉眼可见的力量，而是一种更柔和的力量。我发现自己现在被这种力量所吸引。

为了更接近这个理想，你有什么想要注意的事情吗？

是的，我认为重要的是不要沉迷于某件事或对某件事想太多。如果你着迷，你就会失去洞察力，最终可能会限制你的可能性。我想听听别人的意见，而不是狭隘地看待事情。一旦你真诚地面对眼前的事情并投入精力，我认为正确的平衡就是放松，让它顺其自然。

女性身份对您的职业生涯或生活有影响吗？

我实在想不出任何例子。我想我很幸运，因为我从未因为我是女性而受到任何区别对待。

当然，最好不要经历过这样的事情。那么，无论性别，当你遇到困难或障碍时，你是如何克服的呢？

我确信我经历过一些困难，但我不认为其中有任何困难是无法克服的。所以这可能无法回答你的问题，但这是我确实记得的事情。自从我十几岁出道以来，我既担任演员又担任歌手。当铃木敬一同意在我二十多岁的时候制作我的音乐时，我决定暂时抛开之前的公众形象，在音乐方面回归本源，就像重新出道一样。在这样做的过程中，这个项目的结果非常好。

但当时的广播电视节目类型划分很严格，有些节目我很难出演，因为我也是演员。我从来没有想过我辛辛苦苦打拼的演艺事业会受到阻碍。但我相信我们正在制作出色的音乐，所以我认为我唯一能做的就是坚持下去。最终，我与瑞典制作人Tore Johansson合作创作的歌曲《Romance》被广泛接受。从那时起，我的音乐就像打开了一扇门一样受到平等对待，我觉得我赢得了音乐界人士的支持。

当您觉得音乐行业对您关闭时，是什么促使您继续前进？

嗯，我知道我和铃木先生一起制作的音乐很好。我一直怀着制作好音乐的真正愿望，而不是想要制作热门歌曲。事实证明，我一路走来没有放弃，这一点很重要。我很高兴见到新歌迷，我认为这是我歌手生涯的一个重大转折点。我在二十多岁的时候有过一些经历，通过与人的接触，我的生活发生了改变。你永远不知道你会在哪里遇到这样的相遇，所以我想擦亮眼睛，珍惜我遇到的人。

推出本系列采访的原因之一是 Billboard Japan 排行榜上的性别差距：2022 年，在年终排行榜上最受欢迎的 100 个组合中，艺术家和艺人的性别细分为 58 名男性，27 名女性，15 名混血。这个比例多年来没有发生太大变化。有哪些女艺人一听到她们的歌就会给你鼓励？

我不知道图表上存在性别失衡。我经常从我的大学生侄女那里学习新音乐，最近我和她一起观看了（说唱歌手）Awich 和 Chanmina 的视频。当我第一次看到他们时我很兴奋。他们出现在舞台上，在众多观众面前显得如此威严，充满活力，看起来自发而自由。他们的歌词也非常诚实和强烈，这让你想知道他们的生活一定有多深刻和激烈，因为他们都还年轻。

听到你提到这两位艺术家是出乎意料的！有一个可以教你新事物的人在身边一定会让人感到安心。

当我得知（Awich）要在音乐节目中现场表演“Bad Bitch Bigaku”时，我站在电视机前观看。令人鼓舞的是，我的侄女和其他年轻女性是看着艺术家像这样诚实和口头表达自己的感受长大的。

— Rio Hiral (SOW SWEET PUBLISHING) 的采访首次出现在日本 Billboard

; 反对中不自由表达自己：《Billboard Japan Women in Music》访谈https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/non-billboard-japan-women-in-music-interview-1235461253/ Wed, 01 Nov 2023 17:55:16 +0000 MusicMusic NewsBillboard JapanGlobalJapan https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235461253 Non joins SCANDAL and Nishina on the lineup of Billboard Japan’s Women In Music Vol.1 event set for Nov. 3 at the historic Hibiya Open-Air Concert Hall in Tokyo.

多才多艺的艺术家 Non 与 Billboard Japan 就其女性音乐人采访系列进行了交谈，该系列采访了日本娱乐界的女性选手。日本去年发起的 WIM 倡议旨在表彰对音乐做出重大贡献并通过工作激励其他女性的艺术家、制作人和高管。

Non 与 SCANDAL 和 Nishina 一起参加将于 11 月 3 日在东京历史悠久的日比谷露天音乐厅（被歌迷称为“Yaon”）举行的日本公告牌女性音乐人第一卷活动。在这次深度采访中，这位30岁的女性一直在将自己的活动领域扩展到表演和音乐等流派之外，她分享了她在自己致力于的每个领域自由表达自己并继续强有力地发展的原因。

您将在 11 月份的 Women In Music Vol.1 活动中表演。当你被邀请表演时，你的感受如何？

首先，我很高兴被邀请参加女性音乐倡议的一部分，也很高兴能够与我的乐队一起在日比谷露天音乐厅的舞台上表演。我曾计划与（传奇吉他手）Reichi“Chabo”Nakaido一起在Yaon演出，但演出因台风而取消。这真的很令人难过，所以我很高兴有机会再次与我的乐队一起为 Billboard JAPAN Women In Music Vol. 7 进行表演。 1 次活动。

您可以分享一下您为这次活动准备的内容吗？

好吧，我首先要享受自己。今年我发行了一张名为《PURSUE》的专辑，其中的歌曲充满了有趣和强大的信息，所以我将播放其中的很多曲目。

我们期待在舞台上见到您。本次活动的主题是“支持女性”。你觉得这个主题怎么样？

女性的力量是我非常看重的东西，这也是我作为艺术家的第一次个展的主题，名为《Non's个展——女孩裸露獠牙》。所以我很理解这次活动的主题，并且真诚地认为它很可爱。我希望我在这次活动中的表现能够传达女性的力量和我们的恶作剧。

所以你认为这样的女人很酷。你还记得你从小到大仰慕的女性是什么样的吗？

小时候，我心目中的酷女人就是穿着高跟鞋、穿着得体、毫不费力地走来走去。一个从不绊倒、容光焕发的人。我仍然认为这样的女人很酷，但我不想再成为那样的人了。

你现在的理想是什么？

现在，我的目标是成为一个“追求”（Non专辑的标题）她想做的事情并坚持到底的人。我认为执行自己的意愿很重要。如果我能以一种有趣且有趣的方式来启动它，那就太理想了。即使我正在处理的事情很严肃，我也想把它变成有趣的东西来表达它。

您认识的人中是否有接近您当前理想的人？

矢野亚纪子.我从高中起就喜欢她，经常学习和模仿她的唱歌方式。我一开始很喜欢她的声音和歌曲，但现在我觉得她的生活方式和她的一切都很美丽。

你能详细说说你到底欣赏她什么吗？

事实是她从不松懈。无论别人怎么说，她都从不屈服，始终坚持自己认为正确的事情。我认为她不根据自己是否可能违背常规来做出决定，这真的很酷。

有时，坚持自己的观点或对某事的感受可能很困难。当你遇到这样的困境时，你会如何应对？

每当这种时候，我都会把矢野女士的话牢记在心。我很想像她一样，有一次我问她：“如果我想做一件事，但有一种情绪告诉我不要去做，我该如何像你一样自由地表达自己，做我想做的事？ ”她告诉我，“如果你想做某件事，就继续做，直到你周围的人不再说什么为止。那么大家都会放弃。”从那时起，这句话就成了我的口头禅。所以我确信，在我做我想做的事情的幕后，可能有很多人已经放弃并精疲力竭。 [笑]

您的表达领域跨越多种流派，包括表演、音乐和电影制作。您是否曾在这些活动中感受到作为女性的影响？

说实话，我从来没有真正想过作为一个女人的影响力。但当我看电影或电视剧时，我经常发现自己在想，我感兴趣的角色往往是由男性扮演的。这是一直困扰我的事情。每当我遇到这样的角色时，我都会思考很多关于我将如何扮演它或解释该角色的其他方式，这可能与我自己的新创意项目有关。

在我最近出演的一部名为《鱼物语》的电影中，我扮演了一个男人，坂名君。我之所以能够做到这一点，要归功于导演冲田秀一坚信角色是男性还是女性并不重要。当我思考某些角色只能由男性扮演时，这个角色就出现了，所以现在这项工作非常贴近我的心。

扮演男性角色有什么不同于女性角色的困难吗？

男女体质的差异是不可避免的，所以我不得不压平我的胸部并添加填充物来让我的身体不那么弯曲，但除此之外我唯一有意识地做的就是研究（现实生活中的）Sakana -坤。我观察他的动作、语气以及他如何强调事物，这样我就可以自然地描绘他，但这并不是这个角色特有的，我对女性角色也做了同样的事情。我不认为我只是因为角色的性别不同而做了与平常不同的事情。

我想演员工作的一部分就是扮演那些在现实生活中不会说或做的事情的角色。当你扮演这些角色时，这会影响你是谁吗？

那不影响我。如果我碰巧同情某个角色生活方式的某些部分，这可能会鼓励我或让我相信我的解释是充分的，但总的来说，与我自己的性格或环境相似的角色并不适合我。所以我认为从这个意义上说，我在我扮演的角色和我自己的生活之间划清了界限。

如果让你在刚开始创业时给自己一个建议，你会说什么？

这很难回答，但如果必须的话，我想我会告诉自己调整姿势。 [笑]我现在已经改正了，但当时我并没有真正意识到自己没精打采，所以我想告诉自己要挺直一点。

最后可以分享一首给你力量的女艺人歌曲吗？

矢野明子的《一岳》（《只有一个》）。歌词中夹杂着奇幻的意象，却又贴近日常生活，温暖人心。这是一首浪漫的歌曲，让那些日常生活变得闪闪发光。从那里开始，描绘对他们所唱的人的渴望的副歌直击你的内心，这太酷了。矢野女士的声音温暖而舒缓，但也激起了我的感情，让我兴奋。我认为这首歌包含了所有这些元素。我经常在半夜听这首歌，因为我在晚上往往会感到有动力、更专注、更有创造力。它磨练了我的感官并刺激了我，让我无法入睡。

—平井里央 (SOW SWEET PUBLISHING) 的采访首次出现在日本 Billboard

; 休伊·刘易斯与新闻音乐剧将于春季登陆百老汇https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/huey-lewis-news-musical-broadway-spring-2024-1235460897/ Wed, 01 Nov 2023 17:26:03 +0000 MusicMusic NewsbroadwayPoprock https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235460897 "The Heart of Rock and Roll" had its initial run in San Diego in 2018.

休伊·刘易斯与新闻音乐剧《摇滚之心》将于 2024 年春季在百老汇上演。据《纽约时报》报道，这部喜剧剧于 2018 年在圣地亚哥老环球剧院首演，讲述了一对夫妇的故事，他们的浪漫必须“引导他们的摇滚乐队和企业生活愿望”。

这部“感觉很棒”的音乐剧定于 3 月 29 日在詹姆斯·厄尔·琼斯剧院开始预演，并于 4 月 22 日开放，目前尚未公布演员阵容。该节目借用了 20 世纪 80 年代流行摇滚乐队发行的同名歌曲，该乐队于 1984 年春季在 Billboard Hot 100 排行榜上排名第六，并在排行榜上停留了 20 周。

这部耗资 1600 万美元的演出将由戈登·格林伯格（ 《假日酒店》）执导，洛林·拉塔罗（ 《谁是汤米》）编舞，乔纳森·A·艾布拉姆斯根据艾布拉姆斯和泰勒·米切尔的故事改编的一本书。

In 1991, Prince was at an unusual point in his career. With four Billboard Hot 100 No. 1s under his belt (of an eventual five) and a string of critically acclaimed blockbuster LPs to his name, he was one of the most successful and celebrated names in pop music. Big enough that just two years prior, he could dash off some goofy jams for a superhero flick and top both the Hot 100 and Billboard 200.

11/01/2023

But 1990 wasn't a kind year to the artist soon to be known as the Artist Formerly Known as Prince. The idiosyncratic trailblazer put a lot of effort into directing, starring in and composing music for Graffiti Bridge — a movie sold as a sequel to the smash film Purple Rain — only to see it collapse at the box office. And while his directorial debut, 1986’s Under the Cherry Moon , was a similar flop, he could at least save face thanks to its hit soundtrack, Parade , which produced the all-time pop jam “Kiss.”

No such luck with the Graffiti Bridge soundtrack, however: other than “Thieves in the Temple” – which went top 10 and topped Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs – audiences and critics responded to the movie's songs with polite enthusiasm. What may have really stung, however, was the fact that Graffiti Bridge , as a film and album, seemed out of step with a new decade. In 1991, Prince wasn't passé – but he certainly didn't seem to be steering the direction of pop or R&B radio any longer.

“It's no secret that toward the end of the '80s, things were getting really sort of mysterious — it was hard to tell where Prince was going,” says drummer Michael Bland, who worked with Prince from 1989-1996, with a laugh. “I know that a lot of people counted him out and said, 'you know, well, that's it for the hits.'”

“[ Graffiti Bridge ] was a pretty good, solid record,” says Michael Koppelman, who engineered that album and would go on to engineer, mix and master Prince's following album, Diamonds and Pearls . “The movie was pretty bad and skipped over in a lot of people's heads, so I think he wanted to prove something after Graffiti Bridge was not Purple Rain . Diamonds and Pearls was a departure into a more social thing with his band, which I think was a very positive thing for him.”

Diamonds and Pearls — which was recently given a lush re-release in several different iterations , with the Super Deluxe Edition boasting 11 never-before-released tracks – originally came out on Oct. 1, 1991, and marked the full-album debut of New Power Generation, Prince's first backing band since the Revolution. NPG was primarily made up of players from 1990's Nude Tour, including fresh faces from the Minneapolis music scene as well as friends Prince had known for years. “I was the youngest there – I joined Prince's band when I was 19,” Bland informs Billboard . On the flip side, bassist Sonny T. grew up with Prince. “He played guitar and sang background on one of my first demos,” Sonny T. tells Billboard . “When we were kids, he brought [his 1978 debut For You ] to my house.”

While Prince was inarguably in command of the Diamonds and Pearls sessions (“Imagine going into the military” Bland quips), the mood was noticeably lighter in the studio, according to Koppelman. “They were joking around, it was a lot more social [than Graffiti Bridge ],” he says. “He really liked the musicians in New Power Generation. Like any musician, it's fun to play with musicians you respect and like.”

“He was around people that he knew and grew up around – it's kind of like having family around,” Sonny T. says. “It's like Old Home Week. It was cool.”

The mixture of younger talent and familiar faces seemed to have an invigorating effect on the Purple One. While Diamonds and Pearls isn't a masterpiece in the vein of Dirty Mind or Sign 'O the Times, it's an essential second-tier title in his oeuvre with an urgency and focus absent from his previous three LPs. In terms of re-establishing his commercial bona fides at the top of a new decade, the album sold 2.5 million copies in the US, according to Luminate — making it his best-selling album released in the 1990s. Plus, it gave him four top 40 singles on the Hot 100: the chart topper “Cream,” which came (so to speak) with a scandalous video; the lush, No. 3-peaking title track; the cool, effortless “Money Don't Matter 2 Night”; and the hard, horny funk of “Gett Off.”

The lattermost single boasts a spotlight-stealing vocal (and scream) from NPG member Rosie Gaines, whose impact on the album extended well past what's on wax.

“I'm one of the few people that point out that Prince could be a dick,” Koppelman says, smiling. “I don't think it was necessarily trying to be a dick… but I think he made people nervous purposely to keep people on edge. Rosie broke all of that up. She and Prince had a very friendly relationship that was just infectious. She was so f—king good. When he brought her in to do something, he was just blown away. She was just absolutely lovable and this ray of sunshine.”

Their chemistry is abundantly clear from watching Live at Glam Slam, a concert filmed at Prince's Minneapolis club Glam Slam on Jan. 11, 1992, which is newly available on the Diamonds and Pearls box set. The concert documentary finds Prince and Gaines trading vocals on an incendiary version of “Nothing Compares 2 U”; not only does Gaines push him vocally, but she teases out his impish sense of humor, particularly during a hilarious moment that finds him batting his eyelashes at her with a Chaplin-esque charm.

Live at Glam Slam also reveals how ridiculously well-rehearsed NPG was – six minutes into a 14-minute “Gett Off,” Prince cries out “double time!” and the outfit shifts gears into maximum overdrive without missing a beat.

Of course, Prince was just as demanding of his band off stage. Koppelman, Bland and Sonny T. all talk about the long hours spent recording Diamonds and Pearls over the course of a year. “He was a disciplinarian. He knew what he wanted to hear,” Sonny T. says, sharing that rehearsal might run from lunchtime to 9 at night, followed by hours of studio time until “three or four” in the morning. “Sometimes I just didn't go home – I'd sleep at Paisley Park, go upstairs, take a shower and then start rehearsal again.”

Plenty of the songs took shape over the course of months, with NPG band members learning what songs made the album – and in what shape — along with the wider public. “Unless he felt the desire to show you what he'd been working on, you were just in the dark until he turned the light on,” Bland notes, which he says was the case with “Push,” “Strollin'” and “Willing and Able” to varying degrees. Other tracks – like “Money Don't Matter 2 Night” (which Bland worked on in Tokyo while fighting a stomach bug) and “Cream” were faster. “['Cream'] just came out, just kaboom,” says Koppelman. “I told Prince immediately, 'Prince, you need to release this song, it's gong to be a hit,” Sonny T. recalls of “Cream.” “First, he gave me that look – you know, the Prince look? Then he's like, 'okay.' Then it was a hit – he couldn't say nothing after that.”

Sonny T. remembers Tony M.'s rapped verses on Diamonds and Pearls coming out with similar alacrity. Tony M., who began working with Prince as a breakdancer on the Purple Rain film, eventually graduated to on-mic talent, with his verses factoring heavily into Diamonds and Pearls . “He's just such a great lyricist. He would just write lyrics, right on the spot, just boom, boom, boom, boom,” says Sonny T.

“There was a whole other idea for how Diamonds and Pearls might've been, but I think it leaned a little too hard on the hip-hop of the day,” Bland opines. Thanks to the expanded reissue, we can sample some of the hip-hop-influenced tracks Prince left on the cutting room floor, such as “Something Funky (This House Comes)” and “Glam Slam '91.” “I'm not sure what made him change gears or what informed his creative process to turn to a more commercial direction,” Bland says. “ Diamonds and Pearls is a very positive, bright record. It's friendly. But there's some serious playing on that record.”

“I tend to think of, you know , Controversy and Purple Rain as the best of his career,” says Koppeman. “But it's super gratifying [to have worked on songs that are] an important part of Prince's career.”

“When we got on stage together, that was one of my favorite things that's ever happened to me in my life,” says Sonny T. “We really moved as a unit – it's just clean, cool. And that's a fun thing.”

“I like that I was one of the tools he used to get back on top. We all take pride in that – he chose mostly young, local musicians to reinvigorate his creative process,” Bland says. “Creatively, he kind of had been dwindling in a dark place. And I feel like we helped chase the clouds away a bit.”

SZA , Usher and Summer Walker are the top nominees for the 2023 Soul Train Awards, with nine nods each. The show will tape from a new, for now undisclosed location in Los Angeles, with BET promising: “This year's show will reimagine the traditional award show ceremony into a soulful party in Hollywood.” The show will premiere on Sunday, Nov. 26, at 8 pm ET/PT on BET and BET Her.

21 Savage follows the three nominations co-leaders with eight nods. Coco Jones and Victoria Monét are tied at six nods each, followed by Burna Boy , Chris Brown , Janelle Monáe and October London with four nods each.

SZA's SOS , which is considered a lock to receive a Grammy nomination for album of the next week, is nominated in that category here. In addition, SZA is the only artist with two song of the year nominees here, “Kill Bill” and “Snooze.”

“Good Good” by Usher, Walker and 21 Savage is the only collaboration up for song of the year. It's one of two collabs vying for video of the year, along with “Boy's a Liar Pt. 2” by PinkPantheress & Ice Spice . Both of those collabs are also nominated for – and presumably are the front-runners for – best collaboration.

Most of the nominees are young and still on-the-rise, but there are also some legends in the mix. Ronald Isley (age 82) and the Isley Brothers are vying for the certified soul award. Shirley Caesar (age 85) is up for the best gospel/inspirational award. And the Ashford & Simpson Songwriter's Award, which has been presented every year since 2009, was named in honor of the legendary songwriting duo which was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 2002.

Connie Orlando, EVP, specials, music programming & music strategy, will oversee the annual show and executive produce for BET with Jamal Noisette, VP, specials & music programming. Jesse Collins, CEO of Jesse Collins Entertainment, will serve as executive producer, along with Jesse Collins Entertainment's Jeannae Rouzan–Clay and Dionne Harmon.

“Soul, R&B, and hip hop continue to top the charts and drive culture forward,” Orlando said in a statement. “This year, we are taking inspiration from these genres to innovate and disrupt the award show format while celebrating the legacy of Soul Train . We are proud of this year's list of esteemed nominees and look to deliver an unforgettable night of soul with our new location, performances, and show moments.”
